content: Looking back at the first half of this year, where have you seen God's faithfulness most clearly?
What's one way you've grown in your faith this year that surprises you?
What dreams or hopes did you start the year with? How have they evolved?
If you could thank God for one specific thing from the past six months, what would it be?
What area of your life feels most in need of God's healing or restoration right now?
What habit or practice has helped you feel closest to God this year?
What is God inviting you to step into or pursue in the next six months?
What's one practical goal you'd like to set for your spiritual growth?
If fear wasn't a factor, what would you ask God to help you accomplish this year?
Who in your life could you invest in or serve more intentionally?
What do you sense God wanting to prune away from your life to make room for new growth?
What are you most excited to see God do in the remainder of this year?
Where have you experienced God's grace covering your mistakes or shortcomings?
What Scripture or truth about God has been particularly meaningful to you recently?
How do you want to be different by the end of this year? What would that look like?
What's one way you'd like to love others better in the coming months?
What situation in your life right now most needs wisdom—not more effort or strategy, but divine insight from Jesus?
In what ways have you been trying to live independently of Jesus as your Head?
Can you identify a moment when 'wise' worldly advice actually misled or drained you?
Of the different Hebrew and Greek words for wisdom (e.g., binah, sunesis, phronesis), which kind of wisdom do you need most this season—and why?
When you read Scripture, do you primarily look for knowledge, comfort, or connection with the person of Jesus?
Like Joseph in famine or Jesus feeding the crowd, how have you seen God provide precisely what you needed, even when resources looked scarce?
What hidden gifts or callings might begin to flow more freely in your life—not through striving, but through abiding in Jesus?
When was the last time you paused in a moment of pressure to seek Jesus before reacting?
Where in your life are you still tempted to believe that more knowledge or productivity will fix things—rather than wisdom from above?
Have you ever read Scripture just to check a box, rather than to receive wisdom for your situation?
Do you relate to Jesus more as a Savior, a Shepherd, or as Wisdom Himself?
Can you recall a moment when you felt a subtle prompting from the Lord, but brushed it aside as 'just your thoughts'?
What does “holding fast to the Head” practically look like in your daily routine?
Where in your life are you fixated on what you lack instead of thanking God for what He’s already providing?
In what ways has Jesus revealed Himself more intimately to you this year, especially in areas you least expected?
How has the revelation of “The Third Day” become personal for you this year? Has there been a moment where you felt like you experienced a “resurrection” or turnaround in any area of your life?
Are there requests that are still “in progress”? How are you learning to rest and wait in those areas?
What fresh expectation or promise are you holding on to for the rest of this year?
If Jesus could speak one thing over you for this next season, what do you sense it would be?
How can your group pray with you or stand in agreement with you as the year continues?
Looking at your list of prayer requests from the start of the year, what are one or two things you've seen God answer - even if it looked different from what you expected?
Are there requests that are still 'in waiting'? How has the Lord encouraged you in the waiting?
Did any 'small' or 'silent' answered prayers remind you that God is still intimately in your life?
Have there been any shifts in your heart or priorities regarding your original prayer requests?
Where have you quietly seen God's faithfulness in this past season, even if it wasn't how you expected?
In moments of fear or uncertainty, this year, how has the Spirit sustained or redirected you?
What habit, thought pattern, or desire has God been slowly reshaping in you?
When have you recently felt most aware of your need for grace?
What has tested your trust in God lately and what did you learn about Him in that process?
Is there a difficult place in your life where you now see seeds of growth or redemption?
What is God gently inviting you to release or to pick up in this next season?
If you slowed down long enough to listen, what might the Spirit be whispering about your next step?
Where in your life are you longing for God to do a new thing?
What small act of obedience might open space for greater intimacy with Christ?
How could you make room for silence, rest, or wonder in the coming weeks?
What do you hope to look back on a month from now and say, 'God met me there'?
Where have you been striving in your own strength and how might Jesus be inviting you to rest in Him instead?
When was the last time you felt truly known by God? What helped you notice it?
How would your daily rhythms change if you really believed God delights in being with you?
Is there a truth about God's character you need to cling to more tightly right now?
When has someone's faith recently encouraged or challenged you?
What's been weighing on your heart lately that you haven't had space to name?
When do you feel most naturally aware of Jesus' presence with you, and how can you cultivate more of those moments?
How has your understanding of God's character deepened through both seasons of blessing and seasons of waiting?
How does recognizing God's goodness in small things change your capacity for joy?
